Bungee Jumping

Sorry Ma and Pop!

Posted by Tali on July 31, 2015

I asked my parents if I should go bungee jumping. They said I should not.

Actually, they said I absolutely should not. But I wanted to- and nearly everyone else was- so I did! Woohoo!
Two days later I emailed the family home. Casually, I wrote:

"Check out your brave daughter/granddaughter/sister (at 216 meters, this is the highest bungee jump in the world from a bridge, and the second highest in the world overall--China's tower is slightly higher):"

(I included a video attachment.)

Their responses:

My sister Aviva:
"SO COOL!!!!!"

My father:
"U r crazy!!!"

My sister Arielle:
"Wow amazing! You jumped so quickly, so brave!!""

My mother:
"Unbelievable! I would NEVER EVER try that, and UPSIDE DOWN! Were you nauseous? Any fears? I guess you'll have to check out China's now--then again, DON'T!! THAT WAS ENOUGH!! Thank you for not telling me in advance. I guess you didn't have to have your parent or guardian sign for you. Just come home alive and well! Thanks for sharing, love and kisses, Mommy"

So what do we learn from that? I guess that 1) I am brave, 2) I am crazy fun, and 3) I have crazy good judgment. Thank you and goodnight.
